answers.answer: IDK, my OBGYN will NOT do an internal on me simply because i'm having a csection and he believes it can trigger early labor and also infections.It's good that you don't have PE, but bad that you have hypertension.. it'll go away when you have the baby.And the meds make you feel drunk cause I think it dialates blood vessels and also makes you sleepy. (the migraine med they have me on makes me sleepy too)  it's a cholesterol or BP drug I think. called Lopressor. But i"m only on 25mg which is lower than a theraputic dose.
I am 32 wks and i am 2cm dialated so yes quite possible, then again i went into early labour and doctors managed to stop it....but am still fully effaced and like i said 2 cm dialated... good luck :)

XOXO- wow, are they expecting you to deliver early? How long until they wont stop your labor and just let it go? Isn't it like at 37 weeks?Ya, I just don't like the idea of taking medication while pregnant. I mean, come on, I wouldn't even take a tylenol for the longest time until about last week when my BP went up so high I was crying from the headache! I just wish there was another alternative rather than bed rest.What actually causes dilation and effacement? Is it gravity from being up on your feet? Or just pressure from the baby's head? If I am on bed rest, is there still a chance that I could be dilated or effaced at all? I am thinking that my doctor is going to give me an induction date on Monday. She mentioned it last time, but wanted to try bed rest first.

My doc starts the internal exams at 36 weeks.  I am always at a 1 at that point.  Like clockwork with 5 kids I have been.My mom was 3 cm her entire last month with me and only had me 2 days before my due date, so that doesn't necessarily mean that you will go into labor early.  But hey, the more dialated you are when you have your exams, the less work your body will have to do on the big day!!!
my doc also starts the internal exams at 36 weeks... i see him again next friday.

question: Hey girls... I was just curious if anyone has been dilated at all before they were 35 weeks. I go back to my doctors on Monday and she is going to do my first internal exam to see how things are progressing down there. Is it possible for me to even be dilated or effaced at all? Or is it too early? What were some of you ladies at almost 35 weeks?I also have an update to share. The good news: I DO NOT have preeclampsia. The bad news: I have Pregnancy Induced Hypertension. They put me on Aldomet for my blood pressure... but I don't like the way it makes me feel. I feel like I am drunk when I take it. I am still on bed rest and I am going to talk to my doctor about what else I can do to avoid taking this medication :(
title: Dilation at almost 35 weeks??
